Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NormanWestie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night. I had paid extra for a room with a harbour view and had emailed to ask whether we might have a room on a high floor. They emailed back confirming the request. When we checked in we were given a room on the first floor, you could barely see the water. So not worth paying for a so-called view. I also found the staff pretty aloof and unhelpful. On the plus side, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Beardo2504
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 weeks. Staff were really helpful especially when trying to extend our stay. Room was clean and quiet. Couldn't ask for more from a hotel. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect but Good Enough To Want to Stay again”
Reviews.Author: FrChAKL
Reviews.Content: Very handy to transport - Bus Stop next to the hotel and another one across the road. Walking distance to Kings Cross and the train station. Staff are good - especial thanks to Cyrus who is always helpful - all staff seem to be accommodating. The air conditioning in our room was not working on the first night but was fixed relatively promptly when we raised the issue to reception. Negative - the bathroom fan makes noise but did not bother us because once the bathroom door is closed, we can no longer hear it from the rest of the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelbudSouthWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while travelling. The staff are great, very helpful and friendly. The hotel is at a good location within walking distance of the sights - staff will provide a map, which is very helpful. The rooms are comfortable and have a great view if you pay the extra cost to look over the harbour, which is worth it. It is a bonus having a small but fully equipped kitchen. The Royal Botanic Gardens are definately worth a visit, even if it's just to see the wildlife or sit and watch the boats on the harbour. There is a supermarket across the road and a fair selection of restaurants. The Fountain cafe on the corner next to the pedestrian crossing serves a great breakfast at a reasonable price. On Saturday there is a small market in the park area which also sells some great food and cakes! It is a fair walk to Darling Harbour but it is definately worth it. You also pass some great buildings and parks on the way. The area of Kings Cross is only a short walk away with lively bars, nightlife and internet cafes. The only negative point is that the area is about a 30 minute drive from the airport. The train involves a few changes and a journey of about an hour so its easier to get a shuttle bus from the airport, which will take you to the door of your hotel for about the same price $16. Book tickets at the information desk at the airport. The bus/train transfers don't start until 7am so if you have an early flight you will have to get a taxi, which was $45.

Reviews.Title: “Third bed terrible and noisy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MarcoITA77
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for three and I am trying to sleep in the third one, IMPOSSIBLE, better a tent!!! The mattress is so thin that I can feel all the bed bars, TERRIBLE! In the bathroom there is a fan that does not stop running, and so all night noisy. Terrible experience !

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: thespiv
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for five nights, location is a bit near the red light district of Kings Cross. Rooms are clean, small kichenette,is o.k. for cooking simple meals. Thai restuarant right outside door is o.k. but like most things in Australia very expensive, compared to U.K. Best way to get around Sydney is to purchase a rover ticket, this covers ferries, buses and trains and is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaM_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit dated and wouldn't win any interior design awards, but this is a good choice if you are looking to stay somewhere fairly central without spending too much on accommodation. The kitchenette is perfect for preparing breakfast, but it's by no means a kitchen that suitable for serious cooking. There are a few take-away restaurants and a Woolworth supermarket (good opening hours) across the street. Found the location good in the sense that you're away from all the noise around King's Cross yet not too far from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “It is getting old and worn”
Reviews.Author: Monika1958
Reviews.Content: Was there three years ago and in Jan. 2012. No updates in rooms since than and it was already used back than. Great views and good location are a plus. Unfortunately no balconies. People at reception nice just as three years ago, just aged a little.

Reviews.Title: “Very Efficient Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peewee123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on tour of Oz. Comfy Rooms. Everything thought of in terms of facilities , cross between Hotel & Apartment. Location in Potts Point is not far from Seedy area, but plenty of expensive properties & Restaurants as well. Thai Restaurant that is supposed to be really good is next door. Staff go the extra mile to help. Buses & Trains easy to get nearby. 15 mins on Bus to Circula Quay area. 10 mins on Train to Bondi Beach! delis & Supermarkets opposite. Cant fault it overall NB:. Swimming Pool was being refurbed at time of visit(but as Raining non stop no prob!)

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty and in dire need of a major upgrade”
Reviews.Author: madman101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the New Year's Eve celebrations in order to avoid the crowds rushing to get home. I had booked for 2 adults and 2 kids and they tried to charge me an additional $15 for the kids stay. I had to show them the T&C that kids won't be charged if using the same bed. Rooms are so dated, dirty and bathrooms looked that they've only been painted over. Kids were scared to use it. I'd look for another hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “Three Cheers for MacLeay”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MacLeay at the end of November 2011. We very much appreciated the flexibility of the reservations staff in juggling our dates and accommodating our needs. The room was clean, pleasant, airy, with a great view of Sydney Harbor. We most heartily endorse the MacLeay as a traveler-friendly stop.

Reviews.Title: “Macleay Hotel great base great service”
Reviews.Author: manumartin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel twice -Once prior to our Cruise and again at the end of it. After a long flight with Emirates (great airline) we arrived at the Macleay hotel at 9.30 in the morning hoping to dump our bags and check it later! The hotel were great and said if we waited 20 mins we could check in which was great because we could shower and change before hittting the town. The front deck staff were very helpful and nothing it seem was to much bother for them. The rooms themself were clean comfortable and in good decorative order. They were serviced everyday and the tea coffee and milk replenished. The Hotel is a 25 min walk from the Oprea house and the Bridge with Circular Quay sitting between the two as the transport hub. -- Buses Ferries and trains. When we stayed the swimming pool was being repaired and therefore not in use however the hotel by way of compensation agreed to throw in free internet connection which was great. As for the price it was by Sydney standards very reansonable. In short great hotel great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable, clean, helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner5527
Reviews.Content: Large room (maybe 12 or 14 feet square): comfortable queen bed with nightstands to both sides and a table at the foot of the bed with aisle space between the two. High, small square tub with shower in adequate bathroom. The small kitchen along entry hall met all our needs with the electric kettle, toaster, refrigerator and microwave, and a full complement of flatware, plates, bowls, and cups and glasses. We were able to buy groceries at the Woolworth grocery across the street and eat breakfast in. Occasionally we bought microwavable dinner too. Coffee, tea, milk, and sugar provided. Our room on the 4th floor (of about 8) was adequately quiet above the street. Only four rooms on each floor face the street. The desk staff was very helpful. Only negative was stained carpets (however, note kitchen facilities!). Excellent security provided through 24-hour desk staff and electronic access to your floor only in elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Carole S
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews on Trip Advisor when I was choosing accommodation in Sydney and decided to book at the Macleay Serviced Apartments on the strength of the reviews here. It was the first time I'd ever done that (I normally pick something out of a guide book and confirm with a review). I was not disappointed. I was absolutely thrilled with the view that greeted me every morning and every evening when I came home. The bridge and opera house are THE iconic symbols of Sydney and having a view of both imprinted on my mind is a lovely souvenir and definitely worth the extra dollars to get it. In addition, the staff at Macleay were super helpful. Every question I asked them they answered cheerily and I had a real feeling that they wanted to make their guests' visits to Sydney the best they could be. The room itself is absolutely adequate rather than luxurious but it was clean and had useful facilities that mean I could save a bit of money by having breakfast there. Potts Point is a lovely location because it's easy to get to a train station (Kings Cross is 10 mins walk away), you can walk to the botanical gardens and round to the opera house (about 45 mins) or catch a bus right opposite the hotel. In addition, there's a fast bus to Bondi as well as a bus that goes to the smaller, pretty coves up at Watson's bay. I definitely recommend this as a base for a Sydney stay. I was there five days/four nights and I certainly didn't tire of the view! If you're a light sleeper, you'll need to keep the window shut and I'd recommend earplugs, as Macleay Street is a busy road but really don't let this put you off. It's just worth knowing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Beth094
Reviews.Content: The view of the city was so spectacular that we bought food from the supermarket across the street and didn't even bother to go out on the first night. The staff were without exception really friendly and helpful. We wouldn't go anywhere else if we return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: beaches4me22031
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you what truly makes this spot-the staff! You couldn't find people that were more kind and friendly and helpful. Sure the rooms are a tad bit older and they could use some TLC but every member of the staff and the location make up for that. Having the kitchenette was so handy with the Woollies right across the street. We changed to another hotel halfway through the trip more in the business district and as far as I was concerned it might have been more modern and fancy--it just didn't compare. I would recommend the Macleay without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jtann98
Reviews.Content: My mom, partner and myself booked a triple room with a view for 4 nights at the end of October. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and it was nice knowing that reception is 24hrs. Our room (one single bed, one double bed - no rollaways) was enough space for the 3 of us, the bathroom was a good size and it was very handy to have a kitchenette. The room was serviced daily which you don't always get with apartments so this was great. The location is great - close to Kings Cross subway station and can easily walk into the city if you wanted to. The Woolworths across the road is open daily until midnight which was great - can also recommend the Opium Den and Fratelli Fresh in the area to eat - both amazing! My only complaint would be the view - we were on the 2nd floor and our "view" directly in front of us was of a brick building - the bay was to the left - was nice to see the water but I assumed for the extra money we would have gotten something a little nicer. My advice is to save your money and check out the view from the rooftop - they are easily the best in Sydney and you can get the key from reception. Overall, a very nice stay and would definitley stay there again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Big Bear Lake, California, United States
Reviews.Title: “What A View!”
Reviews.Author: Dana P
Reviews.Content: We sailed to Sydney from San Franicsco on a 29 Day crossing. We arrived at The Macleay Hotel at 10 AM in the morning. We had requested a specific room, but it was not ready that early, so they gave us an even better room with a fantastic view immediately. We had Room # 911 on the top floor. The view was of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the Sydney skyline. It was absolutely beautiful. We had a little kitchen with everything we needed and with the price of food in Sydney, it was very handy to have a Woolworths (market) right across the street. The hotel is close to Kings Cross. We walked there each night and never felt uncomfortable. In fact, it was very entertaining. Lots and restaurants and lots going on. The staff at The Macleay was extremely helpful. Ask for Trevor if you have any questions. He was terrific. He told us about a 7-day pass you can buy for $57.00 per person and they covers the trains, ferries and buses. It worked out perfect for us. The pictures on the internet and the brochure are exactly the way the view and room were. Very nice. It wasn't the Four Seasons, but our friends that were paying $400+ per night at the Four Seasons didn't even have a view. We had a million dollar view! I am a Travel Agent and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any of my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Near Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: Mal B
Reviews.Content: Great experience conveniently located near Kings Cross and a heartbeat away from the city. The room was a little small but the location, service and $$$$ certainly made up for it. Return visit a certainty.

Reviews.Title: “Belated review - Very pleasant, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BearVillain
Reviews.Content: After initially being given a city view as opposed to the requested harbour view, this was quickly remedied and a very enjoyable stay ensued. The view was quite spectacular and the location very handy too. The very lively Kings Cross is nearby (5 min walk) but far enough away for peace and quiet if preferred. The staff were pleasant, friendly and attentive. Overall the Macleay provided good value for money (very competative rates) and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Three Nights in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Vincent S
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Sydney so this time we chose a serviced apartment to give us more flexibility. I can unreservedly recommend the Macleay Hotel. The staff were extremely helpful in allowing us to occupy our room when we arrived early in the day and to leave our luggage for some hours on the day we left.Our room was on the 8th floor with an unrivalled view over Elizabeth Bay and was very quiet. We were given assistance in using the computer in the lobby and generally every consideration. Although we eat out twice, we had all the facilities in our room to prepare our own food if we so desired. The hotel is situated in a pleasant area with a Woolworths' food store just up the road and lots of restaurants in the vicinity. A bus to Gresham Street near Circular Quay runs past the hotel every half hour. We are getting on in years but still found the energy to walk into the city on occasion by following a delightful route suggested by the reception clerk. This was via Wooloomoloo and the botanical gardens emerging near the Opera. Altogether we found the Macleay a great place to stay and it would certainly be our first choice on any subsequent visits to sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel given the limited options in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: Room was of good size but old. The knob in the shower fell off when I turned it and shower flow overall was intermittent. I didn't get a room with a meaningful view but the friendly staff in reception offered that I go to the roof and gave me the key, so I got to see the spectacular view after all. The location is good - it is near King Cross (don't believe what you read about it being dangerous - I didn't feel threatened at all... its just an area with some strip bars and homeless people, no biggie). But its far enough from the strip bars and is actually in a pretty cool, alternative residential area. You can take some nice walks if you like - as I do - to experience the "real" character of a city. Just normal cafes and stores where locals sit and shop. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Robber222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on a stop over from London to Fiji. Staff were great and had helpful tips of where to eat and what to see. The owner was helpful too, booking us transfers to the Airport. The location is really good. Near enough to be close to everything, but far enough to be quiet. We asked for a room on a high floor and we got the top floor! Usually being near a lift is a problem for me as I sleep lightly and hear people coming and going and am woken very easily. This was not a problem at all. For an aparthotel the rooms are a little small and the bathroom was a little tired. But it was spotlessly clean, towels were always fresh and if you want to eat in the room the kitchen is great. There are many shops to buy fresh food (Woolworth's is just opposite) and I would highly reccommed it as a place to stay with very reasonable rates!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value appartment, good location, a little small”
Reviews.Author: Rick_n_Pria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we prefer apartments than hotel rooms. Macleay was very good value. The room was equivalent to most hotel rooms, with a basic small kitchen, and a great location in Potts Point. Definitely better value than most hotels, flexibility to cook in your room, and decent hotel staff. Location great - a wealthy area to live in, with shops and restaurants to suit the residents. A step away from the tourist areas. Hotel gives you a free pass to use a professional gym down the road. Make sure you book on Wotif, we paid around 40% less than most others by using this site.

Reviews.Title: “The view was breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Joy050
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute vacation and we relied on the tripadvisor reviews. We were very satisfied. Pros: We needed a triple for myself and 2 daughters aged 16 and 21. We paid $208 USD per night with no other charges except for the internet which was extra. The kitchenette was convenient and saved us a ton of money on eating out. The grocery store is right across the street and open until midnight. After breakfast in our room we did sightseeing until each evening. We would pick up dinner at the grocery on our way home and then sit and oohh and ahh over that beautiful view. The photos do not exagerate it. The staff was great and we immediately felt at home. The Cons: Kings Cross is the closest train station and while we enjoyed the walk it isn't as close as we would have prefered. By the way, we were not in the least offended by the King's Cross area, but then again we live in Las Vegas so neon massage signs do not bother us. Our room 813 was one of the smaller rooms on the hotel map. To not feel cramped we had to diligently utilize the wardrobe and drawers.

Reviews.Title: “A BRILLIANT AND ECONOMIC START TO STAYING DOWN UNDER”
Reviews.Author: Crinkle17
Reviews.Content: Well situated and in easy walking distance of Botanic Gardens, Opera House and City Centre. Extremely comfortable en suite self catering room, well fitted out and with full facilities for cooking and with plenty of thought for layout. Very good Woolworths across the road for food purchases and next door to a good deli with an excellent and affordable range of wines. Thai restaurant immediately next door with many others in the immediate vicinity. The Manager and staff could not have been more helpful, understanding and encouraging. They even had a bunch of brollies ready for customer use ( we did!). All for $124 Aus per night. We stayed for a week and left with a VERY positive feeling about the whole experience. I am trying to think of a negative aspect but I can't. Go on, give it a try. Martin & Juliet Davis martin.davis@live.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: OscarBH
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed for a long weekend in a one room appartment. The room was not large but was spotless, comfortable, very quiet and had everything we needed. A great deli and supermarket across the road were an added bonus. We loved the area. Walking distance to Opera House, train station, and some great pubs and restaurants. We flew from Melbourne the week of the volcanic ash. Our flight was cancelled and we had to go a day later. We were not charged for the night we missed. We were upgraded to a room with a lovely view over the harbour. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with maps, directions and advice. We left some clothing behind and that was posted to us without any problems. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: sstuff3
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight flight to Sydney and mistakenly booked the room a day earlier than I arrived (booked it for the day I departed to fly to Sydney) and was charged for the extra day when I arrived despite the staff informing me at 1000AM that there were no rooms available for me to check into until after 1200 Noon. It was obvious that they had sold the room erroneously booked the night before but still charged me for it. Once checked in, the room was too small and the layout of the room not comfortable at all. The bathroom and shower were too small and poorly laid out. The staff were rude and unaccommodating to say the least. I would recommend to avoid this hotel is staying in Sydney. There are many other choices, which are better value for your money and have staff that are service-minded. I had intended to stay here for 14 days but moved out after two days because of the poor accommodations and service.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes. Needs updating. Make sure you don't get the murphy bed room.”
Reviews.Author: EatSleepDive
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I booked at the Macleay for a 3 night stay in Sydney and left the Macleay after only one night. I will preface this review by saying that the staff was very nice when we checked out and offerred to upgrade us to another room and told us that we were placed in the only room with a murphy bed. That wasn't the only issue though... -there was toilet paper wrapped around the fire alarm (um, safety hazard?) -the table and chair in the room looked like it was lawn furniture -the ceiling was that awful popcorn nasty stuff -there was only the door knob lock (the chain for the chain lock was missing and the bolt from the deadbolt appeared to have been removed) -the light in the room was a bare light bulb (no fixture around it) Oh, and the murphy bed. Really? On a higher note, I'm sure the views from the hotel are lovely (we had a sample of what the nice views would look like from our room. The location is both good and bad - if you're young and into clubbing/bars/great shopping, I'd heard Kings Cross (very nearby) is awesome. However, if you are travelling with anyone over the age of 40, I wouldn't recommend taking them through Kings Cross at night. The GPS took us through there on the way to the Macleay and let's just say the ladies and gentlemen of the night put my mother off of the area in general. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Well worn room”
Reviews.Author: Mojof
Reviews.Content: Room showed it's age, was small but clean. Tiny kitchen area

Reviews.Title: “Average, a little tired, but well located”
Reviews.Author: bandjotg
Reviews.Content: We had 2 short stays - both rooms were ok, clean, but showing some wear. There was nothing too bad to complain about, but we hope that the rooms will be updated soon. We liked the location. It is close to Kings Cross, but we felt perfectly safe during our stay, and walked in and around the area at all times of the day without issues. There's also a woolworths over the road, and a thai restaurant next door so all dining options are covered. We stocked up on our fruit, and munchies before setting off on our drive to melbourne. For the really great views (as per the web site) make sure you choose the right room type and obviously these are more expensive (however not necessarily any more luxurious? - check first.) We weren't bothered about having a room with a view but for others this could be a disappointment on arrival as our first room looked "into" one of adjacent apartment kitchens. There is secure parking available, and the staff on reception were very helpful. Not a bad option, but we would probably use this as a "fall-back" option rather than our first pick for next visit to sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent views at a price”
Reviews.Author: NLR
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Macleay after staying a week at the Vibe in the CBD. We wanted to stay in the Kings Cross/Potts Point area and there was little available. The apartments are run by very friendly staff. The first room we were given had a faulty TV and a poor view, though we had paid for a good one. They swapped rooms immediately. The new room though small had a magnificent view of the harbour and a superb digital TV. The kitchen facilities were a little cramped but ususable. The only real negative was the shower which was very difficult to get to a bearable temperature - you had to spend half the morning adjusting it! When we left they were really helpful about holding stuff and allowing us to park in their entrance. The hotel is near lots of good restaurants - albeit expensive - and opposite a Woolworth. It is on the 311 bus route and 5 minutes from the Kings X station. I do reccomend it though it has an old fashioned feel; I much prefer Melbournes modernist apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, great location”
Reviews.Author: Surreytraveller2
Reviews.Content: We chose Macleay Apts after much researching of middle grade hotels and were satisfied that we had made the right choice, not just the accommodation itself but the location was perfect. Very easy access to the city attractions without being in the heart of the city. Do not be put off by its proximity to Kings Cross as this was not a problem and we liked Macleay Street itself which had a great buss without being overcrowded. Short walk to Elizabeth Bay and its two small parks are perfect for relaxation and viewing the harbour. We had a wonderful view of the Opera House and Bridge from our room on the 7th floor - well worth paying the extra for - just spectacular. The reception staff were all friendly, pleasant and extremely helpful. There was a little confusion on our arrival when we were given a harbour view instead of a bridge view (probably caused by me!) but although the hotel was full, within minutes the guy on reception managed to juggle things so that we were immediately moved to the room with the view we wanted and it was wonderful as we were staying for ten nights. Although not large the room was quite adequate and we were able to make simple meals with the microwave and two electric rings. If you ask reception they will give you the key to view the harbour from the rooftop. Having seen the location of other hotels we considered, we were so glad we had chosen Macleay and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice room with awesome view”
Reviews.Author: DHowden
Reviews.Content: Chose room with Harbour view or bridge/opera house view. Got the Harbour view, which was amazing despite not being the "famous one". Clean room with microwave, fridge and sink and cupboards. Laundry room on our floor had two washing machines. Woolworths supermarket is just opposite, and Kings Cross station is 10 mins walk down the road. The area around the station is a little seedy (apparantly Macleay St is well know for this), but the hotel is a good distance from here, at the "posh" end of the street. Can easily walk to the Botanical gardens, and then on to city centre. Internet was $15 for 24 hours (a little expensive, but I've seen worse!) The McDonald's down the road provides free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “room 103 - great value in best part of town”
Reviews.Author: ozziecrobar
Reviews.Content: just spent four nights in room 103 - a cosy studio but one of the few rooms to have its own little terrace with a table and chairs looking out towards Shark Island and Clarke Island in the harbour. Macleay Street itself is really noisy but 103 is at back of building so very quiet. And best of all, jsut a minuets walk to al the bars and restaurants of the Cross. Will def. try to book this room on the next work trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lososos62
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. I got there at 8am after a long flight from Los Angeles (checking in is at 2pm) and the very friendly staff let me check in right away. i will be forever grateful to them for that! the mini-apartment was overlooking macleay, on the 2nd floor, but despite the closeness to the street it was not noisy (as long as you keep the windows closed). the bed is comfortable, and the room is small but actually good for one traveler alone. the room looked was very clean and fairly new-looking. the bathroom is much older looking, but it was clean, no funny smell, and there was plenty of hot water in the shower. the staff was very very friendly. the location is really really good: it is less than 10 minutes walk from kings cross station, an easy walk even with the luggage. the area around kings cross is not great looking to me, but as you get closer to the hotel it becomes better and better. the woolworth market open 24 hours right across is a blessing and it did save me good money on food. there is a thai restaurant in the same building which is of ok quality. the internet access is not included in the room and it is $15, which is quite stiff. overall I really enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good price but very dated”
Reviews.Author: thephantomreviewer
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very dated with broken tiles and leaking taps in bathroom. This could have been overlooked but combined with paper thin walls and sharing our kitchnette and bathroom with ants and cockroaches, we did not find our room at all comfortable. To be fair, I think the cleaning staff do a great job - but cracked tiles and worn fittings cannot be hidden by good housekeeping. Mattress was very thin and uncomfortable. The apartments are in a great locaton with some great cafes and delis nearby. The woolworths just across the road, open until midnight, is also very useful. The walk from Kings Cross station is easy and straightforward.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: Missadventure889
Reviews.Content: This place is situated in a great position close to kings cross and across the road from a woolworths and liquor store. Many great delis, cafes and restaurants nearby. Bondi is only a $20 cab ride away as is darling harbour. The pool was very small and because of this we didnt bother to check it out. There was also a BBQ area that looked nice. Front of house staff were not overly friendly but room service/housekeeping staff more than made up for that. One thing I will say is i broke out in small bites after my stay, possibly from bed bugs but i cant prove it was from this hotel and the others i stayed with did not show any signs of being bitten by bed bugs. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bfc2010
Reviews.Content: I would class this as a mid-range hotel and you get what you pay for. I mananged to get a studio for AUD$110 which I thought was exceptional value. The best think about this hotel is the location; there are fantastic cafes/restaurants/nightlife right at your doorstep and downtown is just a short walk. I much prefer this area to the chain hotels and associated coffee shops and cafes around darling harbour. I think I got extremely lucky with my room - not only did I get a good price but I goot a room (number 102 I think) on the first floor that had a large back patio that opened onto the BBQ area and pool area. Pool is very small but serves the purpose if one wants a refreshing dip. BBQ is large and modern, free to use, and the hotel staff cleaned it for me. Andrew "Boy" Charlton pool is a 15 minute walk if one wants a real pool or hop on a train/bus to the beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. Parking $15/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ZeeBeeBristol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in Potts Point just on the cusp of Kings Cross so you have a good mix of noisy bars and trendy restaurants depending on which way you go when you head out of the door. It is also a short walk to the botantic gardens and the fabulous Harry's Cafe de Wheels with it's amazing pies! The rooms are tiny and the kitchen not very well equipped but overall a comfortable stay and good value if you just want a place to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever - our favourite home away from home!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wenloz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i have been staying at The Macleay for quite a few years now and always love it!!! Has the most amazing views and recently nicely renovated rooms. Great place to wander the streets taking in the atmosphere of lovely art deco buildings. Only 2 train stops to the city and wollies across the road for groceries. Staff are always great and wonderful to deal with. Could not recommend a better hotel for the price. An urban gem!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's fine!”
Reviews.Author: arbourstone
Reviews.Content: The is also known as the Macleay Serviced Apartments. It really is just a 2-to-3 star hotel with fridge, microwave and hotplate. There were a few cracks and rusty bits in the bathroom but nothing bad. Swimming pool is small but ok. The real plus point is that it is situated in Pott's Point which is a skip and a jump from The Botanic Gardens which are beautiful. There's period housing on the side streets and it's a short walk through a cosmopolitan-looking area from King's Cross station (be prepared for a block or two of strip clubs but nothing too seedy). The Anzac Fountain is nearby along with a supermarket across the road from the hotel and lots of ethnic restaurants. Although I didn't examine one, I'd probably pay the extra $20/$30 for a harbour view room, but then again this is Sydney and you'd be a fool to spend too much time in your room. Explore!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great view”
Reviews.Author: ClaretAl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights late November. The hotel is in a busy but not too noisy location with many shops and restaurants/bars nearby and not far from Kings Cross with easy access to local transport and walkable distance from the bridge and harbour area. Check- in staff were friendly and helpful and we were able to check in early (around 9.45) rather than have to wait until the afternoon which was most welcome after an uncomfortable 22 hour flight from the UK in Qantas cattle class. The staff also arranged a shuttle bus for our return trip to the airport which costs AU$12 per person. Our room was on the 6th floor and initially we were disappointed when we realised we would not have a view of the opera house and bridge but this was short lived as we opened the curtains on a stunning view of the harbour out towards Manley-if there is a better view from a similar priced Sydney hotel bedroom window we would love to see it! The room itself was a reasonable size with a nice bathroom and a small kitchenette which included a fridge, microwave and toaster and was perfectly adequate for fixing up a quick snack or light breakfast in the morning. The rooms were cleaned and fresh towels provided daily. The queen bed was comfortable enough though we were awoken 2 or 3 times during our first night by some loud unidentified mechanical type noise which we reported to management the next day and it did not reoccur the next 2 nights. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Macleay hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if we ever get the chance to return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shed_gal
Reviews.Content: This was our return visit to the Macleay Hotel as we had a very positive experience when we stayed a few years ago. Like all the other reviewers, we agree the hotel is a bit tired and dated but the staff and the location make up for any downfalls of this hotel. The rooms are clean and tidy, and the rooms are always cleaned daily not something that always happens in lower budget hotels. The kitchenette is sufficient to make small meals or just have breakfast. The real gem of this hotel is the staff that are always super polite, you are greeted and asked about your day every day . When we had to go to a restaurant that we were unsure of the lady at reception Googled it for us, then photocopied the map for us to present to our cab driver to make sure he knew were we wanted to go. This hotel I think is the only one in Kings Cross that also has a swimming pool. It is small but sufficient for a cooling dip especially in the hotter months of the Aus summer. We had been staying with a large travelling group at the Holiday Inn, Potts Point but checked out of there to come to this hotel for the extra days we wanted to stay on purely because of the past pleasant experience, the wonderful, friendly staff and the value for money that this hotel presents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Bed's need updating...”
Reviews.Author: danr21
Reviews.Content: Room 912, great views of the harbour and city skyline. Air conditioner was very noisey. The bed was really uncomfortable for the 7 nights we stayed there. The pillows could also do with up dating, either one is not enough or 2 is two many. Woke up each morning with a really sore neck. Hotel staff member on the Sunday was abit cold to me when I wanted to pay (blonde streaks in his hair) tried to pay the bill on my card but kept getting declined please call for Authorisation. Spoke to my bank in the UK and all was ok with my card, he had to call his credit card services to complete payment as it said on the credit card slip. He got really short with me and I basically thought he was a bit of a idiot. The other staff members were ace, british girl with black hair was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, hotel with great views.”
Reviews.Author: Workforholidays
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for a weekend, but thought the location, staff and views were just great. The staff at the front desk were incredibly helpful. The room was quite small, but fine for two with a lovely view of the harbour. From here you can easily walk to the opera house, catch the bus to Circular Quay or the train is only a short walk. People seem to worry about the location being near Kings Cross. I have stayed in the area before and have never felt threatened by the lively characters you meet day and night in the busy shopping strip near the train station. Had breakfast at Zinc, thought the waiters had far too mcuh 'attitude', but around in Victoria street absolutely loved DOV.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Australophiles
Reviews.Content: The first great thing about this hotel is the location, in Potts Point, near enough to vibrant King's Cross but no so close as to create any noise or late-night disturbance. It's also convenient for the city centre - we walked in on our first day (through the Botanical Gardens), though there's a regular bus service which runs past the front door (and public transport in Sydney is superb). The second is the wonderful view of the Harbour from the upper floors - it's well worth paying for a room with views of the Opera House and Bridge. Thirdly, the helpfulness of reception staff, who seemed genuinely interested in making us welcome, recommending restaurants (and getting reservations for us the first night). Although the hotel doesn't have its own restaurant, there are plenty of others in the vicinity - we dined at the Arun Thai next door (our third visit), then at Fratelli's Paradiso (a few steps down Macleay Street) and finally at the Macleay Street Bistro almost directly opposite. The hotel will provide breakfast in your room, but there's a large Woolworth's supermarket across the road where you can get your own supplies and the rooms, while not large, are well enough equipped for a degree of self-catering. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “decent rate,pity about the bed”
Reviews.Author: pauljamesg
Reviews.Content: A brief one night stay at this reasonably priced & very conveniently located pat.hotel was marred only by an exceedingly hard & unforgiving double bed.If the beds were updated ,the hotel would be a steal ! On site parking also most reasonably priced for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean and nice vibe”
Reviews.Author: anchor228
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the top floor (9th floor) in a twin room next to the lift. The view from the room was brilliant - 180 degrees vision of the harbour, the heads, and the sydney harbour bridge. The room was small but well set out and quiet. Room for bags, a small kitchenette, a cupboard to hang clothes, a desk for the TV and a table for two all sit will in the room. The bathroom was old but in a nice way, so didnt look dated. I thought the lift would be noisy but it wasnt. It is a quiet hotel. The staff are very courteous. We parked our car underneath the building - a tight fit but it all worked. For the price this is a much better choice than a large hotel if you prefer cleanliness, polite staff, and a quiet ambience to the 'empty soul' and often lack of cleanliness that sometimes characterise the larger cheaper hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Cheap Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: typical_guy
Reviews.Content: The Macleay was pefect for my situation. The staff were friendly and very helpful, the room was neat and tidy with awesome views, the Woolworths over the road was very accessible and it was easy to catch a train or get a meal. I even got to "borrow" the hotels fitness first membership to go and do some yoga. The hotel room is a little aged - broken tile, 70's style but this is only cosmetic. I did also notice that if you opened a window, there was nothing to stop you falling out - so be careful if you have kids. I would recommend this hotel as it worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Accomodation in Sydney for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: adwilson
Reviews.Content: Incredibly helpful staff and views are the tow main things to take away from this hotel. The rest of the amenities are slightly above what you'd expect for the price. The staff are more than willing to help you find your way or help you negotiate the incredibly easy (as we found out) Sydney Transport network. We woke up every morning to see the harbour bridge, the skyline and the opera house in the distance. Stunning. In terms of location it is about a 30 minute brisk walk to the CBD or a short train ride away; Kings Cross station being just 5 minutes down the road. It costs about $45 to get a taxi to an airport or the hotel can organise a $12 shuttle transfer for you. The rooms are slightly small but considering price not an issue. The cleaning staff do an excellent job and the rooms were always neat and tidy. Free newspaper delivered to front door as well. You can hear noise from the street but is very quiet and will not disturb your sleep. We had one issue with our neighbours making a racket one night but the management sorted that our for us. The hotel has a kitchenette available for cooking simple meals, which we did most nights, a Woolworth's supermarket is located across the street. If you can't be bothered the hotel has an excellent in-house Thai restaurant as well. The few negatives would be that if you happened to go out at night this would require you to walk through the seedy part of Kings Cross to get home. Although I hear they are cleaning the district up by 2012, so will not be there in future. Also $15 a day for internet is a bit on the steep side especially considering there weren't many 'tidy' internet cafes in the district. However an excellent place to stay on a budget and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheJudge2010
Reviews.Content: Arrived tired from UK, staff were friendly and helpful offering me a guide to what is on in Sydney. Room was nice and comfortable, although a small gripe is there was a small raised lip in the bathroom which could be a nuisance for older people or young children when entering (I placed a towel over it to remind me not to trip), I noticed this in other hotels across Australia and is a bit of a health hazard. Regardless, there was a small amount of city noise but that is what you expect in this location. The skyline view is awesome as you will see from my pics. Air con was great, nice clean bathroom and decent shower, lovely comfy and clean bed. Small pool but useful to cool off none the less. The location is ideal as you have the busy Kings Cross (no worse than an average UK town on Sat night), on your doorstep with bars and nightlife, then the other direction is a more up market Mcquay street with nice restaurants and there is a great cafe across the road, as well as a Woolworths supermarket which is most convenient. The walk to the harbour away from Kings Cross is worth doing as you can walk to Circular Quay. Kings Cross train station is near by and that will take you to Bondi by train and bus within 30 - 40 mins, you may also take a ferry near by that journeys under Harbour Bridge and then you may take a ferry to Manly Beach... In all a great start to my trip around Australia, thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “Value combined with great service & a view to boot”
Reviews.Author: ontourusa
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and luckily our room was ready so we were pleased - front office lady was amazing with details of bus and train trips needed over our two day stay and was very detailed. Room was good for age, well presented and comfortable with a lovely view out Sydney heads - teen-aged daughter was pleased to have ipod speakers/charger and we all loved the view. While not used, the kitchenette was a great idea. shower was good and overall we had a lovely stay. Would thoroughly recommend Arun Thai right next door as a great option for eating, very nice meal and lovely surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Theunknowntraveller
Reviews.Content: Convenient and comfortable. suited our needs so we stayed a week. The staff were friendly and helpfull. Supermarket, transport and restaurants all within walking distance. would be nice to stay again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment really grew on me”
Reviews.Author: Debbbie
Reviews.Content: It was the fabulous position that made us take this apartment. Also it was somewhat cheaper than many of the apartments in the area, which is important with sterling being in such a sad state at the moment. Inside we had a great view of the harbour, but the room was quite small and the bathroom looked in need of a refurrb, so we were going to move on. However, it really grew on us. The cleaning staff are really fussy, so it's spottlessly clean and the whole place has a really warm feel to it. We ended up staying for 9 nights....

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to sacrifice luxury for convenience”
Reviews.Author: SusanMichelle
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the exterior of the hotel create a positive impression but our room and the facilities were very average. Our room was much, much, much smaller than the photograph portrayed. We had to squeeze past the small, ugly, bistro setting just to get in the door. The tv sits on the desk and the room was very cramped. The bathroom was somewhat dated and not entirely clean. On the upside, the view of the harbour bridge and opera house is lovely although oddly, the furniture is not configured in a way that makes it easy to appreciate. The service at reception was generally helpful. I did notice on an elevator journey that the lower floors have newer carpet and look refurbished. We did not stay at a discounted rate so I wondered who gets to stay in the nicer rooms. The outdoor pool is very, very small with no toilet/change area nearby - you will have to go through the lobby. Beyond the hotel itself, the location is very convenient to Kings Cross nightlife and the Potts Point neighbourhood for morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Will use the Macleay again”
Reviews.Author: EastLondonEjs
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have been to the Macleay. The location is excellent. Near to Kings Cross and the station. Buses are convenient (outside the hotel). It is a good spot for access to central Sydney and the harbour. The reception is excellent and very helpful. The room we had this time had a harbour view and is not overlooked as are the rooms with a bridge view. The facilites are comprehensive and the Woolworth's opposite is open until midnight for food and drink. We were allowed, at no extra charge to leave our bags and change before we caught the plane out of Sydney. The hotel needs to upgrade its internet. The central unit near reception did not work well and there was no wireless internet in the rooms. The plug in version in the rooms was expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great & Helpful staff / kitchen benefits”
Reviews.Author: whalestail0630
Reviews.Content: The staff was able to direct you anywhere you needed to travel. THey knew the bus routes and walking ways to the heart of Sydney. They also got us to Bondi Beach with directions as well. Sydney food is very expensive compared to the US and we took advantage of the kitchen and the grocery store across the street. Yes groceries were more expensive than US but it still saved our family quite a bit of money by being able to cook in our room on a hotplate and in the microwave. The rooms were small but our family made due even with our excess baggage for scuba diving. we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return again. THank you Macleay and your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Louise-and-Antony
Reviews.Content: Great views of harbour bridge and opera house. Loved the walk through botanical gardens to opera house. Easy access via Kings Cross station.. yes it is a bit sleazy but we were expecting that. Yes room decor a bit tired but very useful to have apartment and be able to cook/store food in fridge etc. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay to visit Sydney”
Reviews.Author: worldfun
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a 3 star hotel as good as the Macleay, great views to Sydney Harbour, close to Kings Cross, plenty of restaurants to choose from in the area and the staff were all with no exception friendly and competent, reception staff are helpful but not on top of you trying to sell you anytthing to get commision like in other places I stayed before and housekeeping very warm and helpful as well. The rooms even though are not big they are clean and confortable. I stayed 3 nights with my husband and if we return to Sydney will book this hotel again. I would recommend The Macleay.

Reviews.Title: “More flexibility than a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: 5683travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel room sized but with the added bonus of a fully equipped kitchenette, table & chairs. GREAT service from Paulo on reception. District room overlooked the main street which was very noisy (although traffic noise doesn't bother me). Harbour rooms @ the back should be quieter but are more expensive. Washing machines & dryers on every floor - very handy & cheap! 5 minutes to Kings Cross station. Bus stop to city outside. 8 minutes to Fitness First - guest passes from Reception. Kings Cross geared towards backpackers & adult entertainment but always busy and never experienced any trouble. Good location, easy to walk through to the beautiful Elizabeth Bay, Rushcutters Bay & Double Bay. Or cut across the Domain to reach the city in 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ReflexSheffield
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was ok, the room was a little on the small side. To have a shower you first had practically climb over the toilet to get in. The decor was a bit tired and could do with a bit of a freshen up. The reception staff were a bit hit and miss, the majority were good and their knowledge and information was appreciated. However one of the reception staff was extremely hard work, trying to get any information out of her was like pulling teeth and she had such a sour look on her face all the time, we never got a smile out of the whole time that we were there. The view from the room however was fanastic. The train station is about 10mins walk from the apartments but it is through a bit of a sleazy area called Kings Cross. its full of late night bars, strip clubs etc. I wouldn't stay here again, I would prefer to be a bit closer to the main attractions and further away from Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff, good rooms & equipment”
Reviews.Author: maturetraveller_9
Reviews.Content: We were on 8th floor " with harbour view" and expected a glimpse of the harbour but got wonderful views including the opera house. We walked through the botanic gardens to get to the opera house. Very good value is a day travel ticket which covers unlimited train, bus, ferries. The ferries round the harbour are as good as tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Vapsemand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in september 2009. Staff was really friendly and helpfull. The rooms is perfect for 2 persons.The location is great, only 5 mins. to Kings Cross station, and Woolwoths is just across the street. There is a lot of great eating opportunities on Macleay street, and a lot of cosy cafees. If I sholud stay there again, I would opt for a room with a view over the harbour. When you stay here you have access to Fitness First at Kings Cross. Great place with a view over the harbour and habrour bridge.

Reviews.Title: “functional room, great location, everything else... bleh”
Reviews.Author: jjoz
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Sydney from San Francisco, decided on a low key hotel based on the location of this hotel, perfect for the tourist who wants accessibility to tourist spots without the tourists. Potts Point and the hotel location were exactly that. The hotel itself was not quite as nice as the pictures in Amex travel made it look, the hotel seemed more run down than the pics made it appear, but it was clean. The bldg and room remind me of cheap motels in the states in rundown areas that made a fleeting attempt at revival during a decade that was bad for style... like the 70's maybe? The views are not everything other reviewers make them out to be either. The service was also so so. Nothing particularly bad, but nothing out of the ordinary. I've found that to be the case in Australia period though. Relatively inexpensive, but overall value, It appears from checking travel sites and now having explored Sydney a bit, you would get a better value at a chain hotel, even if it is something of a local chain like the Quest hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: solidgolde
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a pleasant one week at the Macleay thanking all those Tripadvisors before us who had recommended this hotel. We were in Room 710 and had a spectacular view of the harbor. The room was small, but workable. The kitchen was well-stocked. A Woolworth's was nearby where we could pick up goodies for breakfast. The front desk staff was eager to advise us on the best ways (on a map he provided) to get where we wanted to go -- pleasant walking routes to the wharf through the botanical gardens as well as the convenient bus line which stopped in front of the hotel. The hotel is on the Airporter Shuttle's route, which made it convenient both coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints just gratitude”
Reviews.Author: albertmunroscotland
Reviews.Content: Some folk do like like to have a good old whinge! Sorry, other reviews motivated me to write. We stayed here for 11 nights in June and found everything as advertised to be just grand. I also concur with the reviewr who said that the staff were so helpful and friendly. We knew what we were doing for the 11 days that were there so it suited us just great to come back and relax. It was also cerainly value for money. Thanks again to all at Macleays and best wishes to you all.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: KaitaiaAlison
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in these apartments. After checking out other trip advisor reviews we chose this one mainly due to the view and location. The views were fine if you stood up but the room was far too small and not suitable with a teenage son in tow. It was very much in need of redecoration and the lifts were very suspect. Ceiling tiles were coming off the ceiling, but it is obviously undergoing renovation. Very close to Kings Cross which was not such a good thing. The only redeeming feature was that it was quiet and the staff pleasant. I would certainly not recommend these apartments to families more suited for back packer type accommodation. We checked out after the first night and found the perfect apartment closer to the city and for an extra $5 a night - The York Apartments which I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not as advertised, dangerous equipment in kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: CandELondon
Reviews.Content: In two months of travelling this was the only place where we had any cause to complain. The room had apparently been renovated but it already looked tired and worn with exposed wiring and pencil markings on the wall. The bathroom looked very old and staff later confirmed these had not been part of the renovation. The first room we were in overlooked a building site and the hot plate had to be plugged in partailly hanging over the sink with the wire going across the sink, VERY DANGEROUS! We spoke to the gentleman on reception who seemd unimpressed and informed us the room we were in was already an upgrade (!) to harbour view even though it was mostly building site view. The manager came and spoke to us and although she didn't seem very pleased showed us a much nicer alternative room where we could safely plug in the hot plate and with a nice view of the Harbour Bridge and city. Also, the free in room movie channels advertised were 'broken' the entire 17 days we were there and the free gym was not on site but a 10 minute walk away. Once there, facilities were sufficient but it was in the red light district which may put some people off, especially lone women at night. We appreciated being moved, and the hotel was in a good location (as long as you don't mind walking a bit) but we felt it was not as advertised and some of the staff were reluctant to help.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend Macleay Serviced Apartments”
Reviews.Author: TravelwithmeArizona
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed w/Macleay and are very happy that we did! Although the rooms are a bit small, they had everything fully stocked and the room overall was clean. The location at Potts Point is superior to all of the main attractions! In fact, our walk to the Opera House through Botanical Gardens was simple as well as beautiful! However, my personal highlight of our stay was how well management and front desk personnel went out of their way to help us with several things such as "don't miss" local places and "how to get around" with high-lighted maps and all! Even made phone calls on our behalf so that we didn't have to use BlackBerry Global service. During our stay, I managed to leave clothes at a prior hotel on the Gold Coast and the Manager, Susan, took her time to follow-up with the once lost box, re-addressed it, and then took it to the "post" to mail to me in the States! When I offered to tip her for her help, she replied "thanks, but no thanks. It's my job to assure your stay with us was a pleasant one". Ask for Susan when you check in and tell her "Holly from the States" recommended you!

Reviews.Title: “Talk to Susan and chose room 610”
Reviews.Author: evelynFrance
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view, excellent location, great 311-the bus defront your door for everywere what is important in Sydney. You have woolworth oposite your door, a great cafÃ© and a Deli for delicious food. The hotel is cheap, clean and calm. The air conditioned is eficient and quiet. You have a small pool. Its the best! Thank you Susan at the reception-You give me the best help in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: OneSpecialBloom
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. The room, thought quite compact and a bit â€˜datedâ€™ in decor, was clean and comfortable. It was on a bus route that got us to the Circular Quay in about 15 minutes. (From there we could get anywhere!) We would definitely stay there if we ever happened to be in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great - if you like builders watching you all day!”
Reviews.Author: AJB1981
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised that no one has mentioned this in other reviews. I booked a harbour view room on 7th floor and stayed in the final week in February. There is a huge building site going up to level 7 or 8 with builders starting work at 730 am and not finishing til 5pm Monday to Saturday. I had to keep my curtains shut the whole time I stayed as there were hundreds of builders peering in at me. The view is also completley obscured by it. As for my room - it was clearly a smoking room (I requested non) as it STANK. I would definitely NOT book it. THe area is lovely - really lovely selection of deli's and cafes on Macleay Road, but it is quite a long trek to all the attractions. Give it a miss and be suspicious of the good reviews

Reviews.Title: “Value Value Value in Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: captaingary
Reviews.Content: Best value place we stayed at in Australia! Near shopping and great restaurants and the action at King's Cross! What a wonderful surprise! Great value for an EXPENSIVE city ($100/night!). Room and bed were scrupulously clean! The views of the harbour were TERRIFIC! We could see all the way to Manly! Good room service at the exact minute requested and delicious breakfast! Clearest LCD TV picture and most programming we found anywhere in Australia for FREE! The lady at reception at check-in seemed mad at the world. Maybe she hadn't yet heard, "NO WORRIES!" The man at check-out was ebullient! He was so helpful and kind, calling our airport transfer bus company 4 times! He told them they had better pick us up as we had booked the night before. The bus company claimed not but we had made the call from the hotel and he had the receipt he told them. If it weren't for him, we would have probably missed our INTERNATIONAL flight! This is a GREAT HOTEL! The manager of the CRAPRICORN resort in Yeppoon would be wise to stay a week here to see how to run a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great view!”
Reviews.Author: Mariebekar
Reviews.Content: browsing the Internet for a good place to stay I happened to stumble over the Macleay serviced apartments and was fortunate enough to find this studioapartment on the 9th floor. So, ok, I've book over the Internet before and know how a camera can lie and make things look better than they really are, but this time the pictures were only half as good as the real thing! The room was very good with a kitchenette and a bathroom, the view of the harbour, the opera house and Sydney Harbour bridge was absolutely fantastic! Not to mention the cockatoos cute and the wailing black bird that woke us up each morning was real fun. Not to mention all the flying foxes we could see migrating from the Botanic Gardens each evening around 7.30-8.00 pm. Top that off with wonderful staff who always helped us with a smile and gave extremely good service. We couldn't have been more pleased. We stayed in the middle of the action and could walk everywhere in Sydney. This is a hotel we would return to every time. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: dennyandtony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Macleay apartments for 7 nights. The stay was wonderful, they allowed us to check in at 10.00am as our room was ready, which after such a long flight was great. Our room had the most glorious views over Elizabeth Bay - the sunrise in particular was spectacular. Our room was compact but had everything we needed with basic kitchen facilities. The location was great with easy access to excellent restaurants and great transport links to the City. Best of all though were the staff they could not have been bettered. My husband had his wallet stolen by a pickpocket in one of the cities bars, the staff were great with very useful advice and checking that our cards had been stopped. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: DandCLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 16 very enjoyable days at the Macleay Serviced Apartments and would like to sing their praises. The views from our room was spectacular, the room was well appointed , the position in Potts Point is excellent for restaurants etc and the service from the staff was brilliant. We will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Glad we picked it”
Reviews.Author: Leedsroamer
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 days here immediately before Xmas, staying in a serviced apartment with a harbour view and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The amenities are good, the servicing could not be faulted, the accoutrements were of a proper standard and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. We felt comfortable there. The location and surrounding area are both good, it is on a bus route and there is a railway station within a reasonable walkable distance. We have no hesitation in recommending it

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ian025
Reviews.Content: Arrived from New Zealand on tour greeted at reception with a warm welcome, at asking how we are and formaly greeting us. We had booked a Harbour view room we were on the 7 floor room nu 710 from this room you could see over the Botanical Gardens Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House it got a wow factor from us at night dusk you can see the bats flying over the park to the Manly its a great sight. Room well equipt plenty of space and the with all you need, Buses right outside hotel, did not use pool as to cold and not enough time. We would deffinetly stay there again and recomend to our friends Pam And Ian Dawes

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good choice”
Reviews.Author: OliveNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The only available room was one of the cheaper 'district'' view rooms, not one of the ones with a harbour view but when we arrived we were offered one with a little peep of Elizabeth Bay and its own patio area which was great. (BBQ also available) The first floor is a smoking floor but this wasn't a problem and I'm usually very fussy about the smell of cigarette smoke. All in all we were very pleased with the hotel, and I agree with other comments: clean, smallish, very convenient, friendly helpful staff, great location good kitchenette with a cook top available as well as a microwave, etc.and good value. A few very small gripes: no bedside lights but when we asked we were immediately given one. Fairly quiet where we were although we could hear the chairs being scraped on the floor in the upstairs room, fortunately not all night! Finally the perfumed smell in the room was a little overwhelming and I sneezed a fair bit for the first night, fortunately warm enough to have the windows open but I do wonder why hotels use these highly scented products. Is it to mask some other smell? like cigarette smoke>?

Reviews.Title: “Best accommadation in sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2007 and found it to be excellent. We had just come from a terrible experience with another hotel in the area and came here for respite. To say the staff were friendly and helpful is a complete understatement. They answered every question and assisted us in every humanly possible way they could. The room was beautiful and modern, and the view of the harbour bridge, opera house, and elizabeth bay was breathtaking. Being serviced, we barely had to lift a finger. Very central location to everything, 1/2hr walk to opera house/circular quay, 5min walk to kings cross station. Beside bus stop. Opposite woolworths, cafes/restaurants/shops only steps away. Highly recommend staying here for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Macleay”
Reviews.Author: prinret
Reviews.Content: Some time ago I searched for accommodation in Sydney, Australia, for two senior ladies who were spending a week there prior to boarding a one-month cruise. We had several suggestions through the chat lines and finally settled on the Macleay Serviced Apartment Hotel. We were warned that it was only 3 1/2 stars and was a little shabby but conveniently located, safe and clean - our main priorities. For us it was an excellent choice. The Macleay is located in Potts Point. There are a number of coffee shops and restaurants within close walking distance and a food store and pharmacy are located right across the street. The bus stop in either direction is a short walk from the front door and the city bus will take you to Circular Quay in one direction and the railway station in the other We had a studio apartment and were able to make our breakfast and occasionally lunch. The apartment was on the eighth floor and from our window we could see the Sydney harbour bridge and the opera house. In the other direction was a marina. The view was unobstructed and a real asset. In fact, one morning we saw the Mercury (which was to become our home away from home for a month) sail into the harbour. It's not often one can say, "We saw our ship come in!" Although the furnishings could do with an update, our apartment was certainly clean and comfortable. It was serviced daily. The rate was reasonable given Sydney's prices that we found to be high by Canadian standards. The best of all, however, was the staff. Although the accommodation was only 3 1/2 stars, the service was 6 stars. The staff was exceptionally helpful and couldn't do enough for us. In other locations we had stayed in excellent hotels but none exceeded the service provided by the staff of the Macleay. Lest you think I am on the payroll of the Macleay, nothing could be further from the truth. However, if we ever return to Sydney - a real possibility because we fell in love with the city - we are going to stay at the Macleay. If you are going to stay there, ask for a room with a harbour view. There is another building going in next to the Macleay that may obstruct the lower floors so ask for the eighth or ninth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the views and friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: w-j-b1954
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed for 5 nights at the Macleay, we thoroughly enjoyed the visit...great location we walked through the Botanical Gardens to Circular Quay on several occassions, we ate at surrounding restaurants. We found all the staff to be most friendly and helpful and would definately go there again, would always pay the extra for a room with a view. The room and pool area was smaller than we thought it would be from looking online but both were adequate for our needs. We both thought it was good value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great for New Years Eve!”
Reviews.Author: Stroppers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in May '07 for NYE '07. It wasn't our first choice because of reviews and location (was concerned about the red light district). It was also very expensive - but you have to expect that in Sydney on New Years Eve. When we booked, we were told that there were only rooms with city views left, but that that would get us an invite up on to the roof for the fireworks at both 9pm and 12pm. However, when we checked in, we were gobsmacked by the view we had. Unobstructed views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge to our left, and the north headlands to our right (7th floor, can't remember what room). We literally could have sat in our room and had one of the best views in the city! We had an Australian friend staying in the room with us who lives just outside of Sydney, and she said that it was one of the best view of the fireworks that she had experienced, and without having to fight your way through the crowds to get a drink. In the morning, we went down to collect the local newspaper and found that the photo of the fireworks on the front page had been taken from the roof of the Macleay for the 3rd year running!! Yes, the rooms are a bit dowdy, but the staff were polite and helpful, and the hotel is not actually in the red light district. We walked through that area a couple of times, but it was amusing rather than threatening!! Actually didn't see anything to write home about other than a homeless man being propositioned for $8!! The rooms are compact - especially for 4 adults, but we were warned of that by the hotel before booking. The kitchenette is small with few amenities, however, with some creativity, we managed to cook a full English breakfast for 4 adults on New Years Day!! If you are thinking of heading to Sydney for New Year, and don't want to get caught up in the crowds, we would highly recommend the Macleay.....but don't expect the Ritz!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay for the view alone”
Reviews.Author: hungarianelephant
Reviews.Content: First of all, you should definitely pay for a room with a view. It is maybe an extra A$15 (EUR10) per night, and for that you also get a quieter room, away from the traffic. How many times will you be coming back to Sydney? Over the course of a week, we stayed in 3 rooms here, all of them different. The Marriott it ain't. The air conditioning broke in the first room, after it was unable to cope with being turned off for an hour (huh?). The second was slightly less convenient - on which more below - and since we hadn't fully moved in we plumped for the one next door to our original room. The staff are excellent and were able to check us in at 11am - rooms are cleaned in an order which suits the guests, which sounds obvious but rarely happens. It's fair to say that the accommodation is a little basic and could probably do with some renovation. You are not going to be able to cook a gourmet meal here, but it's fine for an omlette and toast. Chief amongst the problems are a lack of storage space in many rooms. Our first room - a wooden floored space - had drawers within the bed. The second had basically nothing, and the third was ok. There are two types of room with a view. Some face the eastern end of the harbour, others face the Bridge and Opera House. (The hotel won't guarantee which you will get by paying for the view, but it's worth asking anyway.) The latter is, as you would expect, spectacular. However, the rooms here seem to be more dated, and they are also over the road, which means more noise, though 9 floors up that won't bother anyone used to living in a city. The views facing the other way are not so bad either, it should be said. The location is not bad. Most people, including my 70 year old mother-in-law, could walk into the CBD and back comfortably, though it's rather hilly (hence the views). Kings Cross station is a 10 min walk away, and from there you can get to Bondi or to the central district. If you're trying to get to the main tourist attractions, walking might be more convenient than changing trains. Since the bus only runs every half hour, we didn't bother with it. Taxis run past all the time, including 5am when we had to leave for the airport. Don't bother booking. Yes, Kings Cross is a red light district, but it isn't so bad (and it's one of the few places in the city where you can eat late - everyone else seems to go to bed early here). Anyway, the hotel is outside that strip, in a fairly pleasant mainly residential street. Overall, we'd be happy to stay here again and probably wouldn't bother looking anywhere else, unless the rooms with views were all unavailable. But there's no doubt that the rooms are of variable quality, and it's worth asking to see a couple if there are any free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: KimandJames
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 901, while room a little dated the view more than made up for it. Had recently read to ensure 8th or 9th floors to get a great view - our room had view of city, Opera House, Bridge and right around to the North Heads. We arrived around 11am and they went to work on our room and had it ready for us in 1/2 hour - staff were most helpful. Good rates are available through AAA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: AnneMareeF.
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed overnight whilst the QM2 & QE2 were in Sydney Harbour. Our room on the 4th floor, whilst older in style, was very clean with a pleasant smell on entering. Our window view was down Sydney Harbour to the Heads and we had a fantastic view of the QE2 arriving and the QM2 departing. The hotel management opened the roof area for the QE2 arrival, the fireworks display, for which we had one of the best views possible. The kitchinette had all you could need and we intend staying there next year when the new QV2 visits our shores. The staff were most helpful and the hotel is surrounded by restaurants, cafes,a wonderful deli and a Woolworths supermarket across the road. All services are at the door. I disagree with the negative responses for this hotel, it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: AshesUk
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Macleay apartments on 2 January for 10 nights and agreed a rate for the period. The room and service were fine and the staff friendly, until checkout when I found that the hotel charged me significantly more than the rate I had agreed. When I pointed this out, I had nothing in writing to support my case. I had asked for this on check-in, to be told details were entered into the computer system and everything was fine. So, make sure you have something in writing with them before checking in as to how much you will be expected and are prepared to pay.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: Keith.Voorschoten
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms with compact kitchen with the bare minimum of equipment. Some rooms (especially on the 9th floor) have amazing views across Sydney Harbour and the Opera House - very picturesque in the evening at sunset.
