Located 5 mins walk from Kings Cross (not the most salubrious area of Sydney) and 30mins from downtown. Clean rooms and friendly staff offering a 24hr check in. (Useful for those early moring arrivals at Sydney airport), Supermarket across the road with a large variety of bars and restaurtants in the area, Slightly more upmarket than your average backpackers hotel/hostel. Good priced for Sydney however.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: 30Alex
Reviews.Content: The location was nice - just across a supermarket, next to Kings Cross, almost walking-distance (at least for us) to all the main sights (opera house, darling harbour, tower, botanical garden,....) We had a 2 bedroom apartment with one bathroom, a big kitchen and a fairly big living room. The bedrooms were also ok - nothing special and almost clean (don't look under your bed). The price was really good for Sydney. I would stay there again, but first I would make sure the bedrooms are not facing the mainstreet - it can get loud.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and shabby”
Reviews.Author: brookbridge
Reviews.Content: Having been booked in by Australian friends, my wife and I stayed twice at the Macleay, firstly for three nights and secondly for one night prior to leaving Sydney. Your description of the hotel as 'a small charming hotel in a 130 year old mansion' is somewhat strange, this is a high rise block having seen better days. The interior as a whole is shabby, dingy and uncared for. The elevator floor could not have been cleaned in some time. Rooms, although clean, were cheaply furnished and poorly decorated with only the wonderful view to compensate. However, our ninth floor second room had only a partial view, as half of the room width window had been boarded up with unpainted rough plywood. On complaining, the explanation given was that the window had fallen out in a high wind and was proving difficult to repair. On examination the remaining frame appeared to be suspect. We were told that no other room was available, take it or leave it. No apology was offered. As this was for only one night we took it. This hotel is not worthy of a three star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: geordiejon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Macleay apartments over the New Year and found them to be fine for the money you spend to stay here. The price was a bit higher at the time of the year we were staying (everywhere is full in Sydney for New Year and was asking stupid prices, but we found it to be really good value. The apartments are in a realy good area- Potts Point, next to loads of little cafes and bars and only a short walk down to Woolloomooloo water front where there is loads of good bars and restaurants- and Harry De Wheels food place. It is close to Kings Cross, but to be honest i didn't find the place scarey at all- either through the day or night. The staff at the Macleay were all really helpfull, and told us how to get around Sydney and where to go. We were very tired when we got there - (after 22hours travelling from the UK), and got there at 9am- but they let us check in early. Our apartment was one of the newly refurbished apartments, so it was all new, lots of mirrors, wood floors and new furnishings. The only gripe would be there was no where to store your clothes etc and had to live out of our suitcases. The little kitchen was fine- you could make toast or snadwiches in it- don't think you could cook a full meal- but it was fine for snacks etc. Did have a look in the older apartments and they didn't look half as nice as ours- so if you get put into a old one ask to be changed to a newer one. One point though- the windows don't look very safe- we had a bad storm one night (night of 1st Jan after 44c temps!) and the windows above us blew out ground below. I heard the manager saying that they were going to reglaze the rooms anyway but would have to do it asap now. Would defintitely stay here again though, and would recommend it as long as you just want cheap(ish) clean accomodation in Sydney. A plus is that Potts Point and Wooloomooloo are great and the CBD is easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mikekb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for one night at Macleay. The staff were very friendly on the phone when I made my booking and answered all my questions. The actual hotel is a bit scruffy, and the car park had an old mercedes with no number plates and a thick thick layer of dust. However, the view is absolutely amazing for the money we paid. We stayed in a harbour view room and could see from north sydney all the way across to centrepoint tower. The room was a bit cold but the staff gladly gave us an extra heater to keep us warm. The staff were really great, attentive to our needs and very helpful. There is a hotplate, little fridge, microwave and a noah's ark of cutlery, glasses etc in the room, I imagine you could eat in and enjoy the views quite easily. I would stay here again. Great budget hotel in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “tired old place, that needs demolition or refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: VicM
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 and stayed in the Macleay in June 05. We booked the hotel based on the previous reviews and expected something special from this hotel, unfortunately we were extremely disapointed with what we found. The hotel is a 1960's structure and the hotel rooms were of a similar decor. Hotel furniture was old and worn, the room was rather drab and depressing, the bathroom was as old as the structure it was contained in and the room was rather tight to say the least. I must say the rooms were clean and the service was OK. The hotel carpark was just as tight as the rooms. The hotel was not cheap in comparison to other hotels in Sydney, for an extra A$10 a night you could stay at the Hyde Park. The location was fair, unless you are interested in visiting Kings Cross, expect at least a 30 to 50 minute walk to most attractions, of course, you can catch public transport. I would not stay in this hotel again, next time I will pay a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Serviced means serviceable”
Reviews.Author: Poozer
Reviews.Content: During a 5 week vacation, we spent a week in Sydney at the Macleay. It was recommended to us by a Sydney local that owns an apartment in the building. The staff were very, very helpful and friendly. We got an East Bay view room that had a spectacular view on the 9th floor. The location at Potts Point was very convenient for pharmacies, grocery stores, and cafes. FYI, the website doesn't mention the long sidewalk-stairs at the wharf and park that make it 20min from the Royal gardens and the Opera House. Still a nice location. I was concerned about its proximity to Kings Cross, but the streets were very safe. I'd recommend the place with the following caveats: 1) The apartment we had was smaller than it seemed from the website. 2) The bathroom shower we had was in a corner with a small step into it (no functional bathtub), and a curtain that surrounded two sides. Very small. 3) They charged an extra surcharge for Easter that other hotels would not have, but they notified us of the extra cost when the reservations were made. I would say that the apartments were very affordable for Sydney, except for the surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. Once with my 17 year old son (then) and again with a friend for the RWC in 2003. Fantastic value for money with the best views in Sydney! All of the CBD right round past the Bridge, Opera House and the rest of all the Harbour. Half an hour's walk to SOH through the Botanic Gardens passing the naval yard and Harry's Cafe de Wheels. Plenty to eat and drink locally. Only downside was King's Cross - but not too bad as the area is quite small. Hotel has a car park -but not necessary to have a car in Sydney as it's easy to get about on foot. Will and am going there again. Very friendly staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: duggie
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week in Sydney. Stayed at the Macleay and loved it! Very reasonable rate for a room with great harbour, opera house and bridge views. We price similar views in other hotels and consider we got a bargain. Nice neighbourhood - great cafes and restaurants nearby. Half hour walk through the Royal Botanic Gardens to the Opera House. Central for everything. Front desk staff were very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: steedman1
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney for the first time the last week of July, 2004. I picked the MacLeay because it was listed in several guidebooks. The location in Potts Point was excellent--close to bus stop, many good restaurants, a grocery store a block away, several parks nearby. I had a rental car, and paid 11AU a night to park it, but next trip--no car! It was actually inconvienient and expensive. The hotel had a 24 hour desk and a secure lift. The room was very clean--smallish, but had a small kitchenette and an incredible 180 degree view of the harbor. Windows opened wide, and the weather was stellar, although the pool was not yet available--July is early spring. Everything I needed was available, room was quiet, Computer with internet available at $5AU an hour--a bargain, since it was available 24 hours too. Room service was available, but with cafes and restaurants everywhere, why bother? Daily maid service was appreciated, and the staff were really very friendly and helpful. Don't forget to visit Watson's Bay and Doyles restaurant--easy to get to from any point in Sydney, by ferry or bus. As an older single traveler, I loved the friendly cosmopolitan atmosphere of Potts Point, safe, but still distinctive--not high end, but more fun for being less touristy. Lots of college students in the area. Somewhat near rowdy Kings Cross, but a world away as far as night life. Not recommended for families with small children--no entertainment for them--parks did not have playground equipment, and there was traffic most of the day. You cannot beat the value. Not much on TV, I had brought a portable DVD player that was excellent for the rare time I wanted to rest.

HotelInfo.Name: Macleay Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 28 Macleay Street | Potts Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
